getPathSeparator

public static java.lang.String getPathSeparator(com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.DeployModelObject object)
Returns the path separator for the OS hosting the object directly or indirectly.

Warning: uses discovery

Parameters:
object - a deploy model object.
Returns:
the separator charactered inferred by discovering the operating system hosting the deploy object, or null if the OS is not found.

getPathSeparator

public static java.lang.String getPathSeparator(com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.DeployModelObject object,
                                                java.lang.String samplePath)
Returns the path separator for the OS hosting the object directly or indirectly, or guesses from the sample.

Warning: uses discovery

Parameters:
object - a deploy model object.
samplePath - a sample path to guess if the OS host is not found.
Returns:
the separator charactered inferred by discovering the operating system hosting the deploy object, or null if the OS is not found.
See Also:
guessPathSeparatorFromPath(String), getPathSeparator(DeployModelObject)

isValidWindowsPathWithDriveLetter

public static boolean isValidWindowsPathWithDriveLetter(java.lang.String p,
                                                        boolean allowForwardSlashes,
                                                        boolean allowLeadingDollarChar)
Parameters:
p - an install path
allowForwardSlashes - set to true to allow forward slashes in a windows path.
allowLeadingDollarChar - set to true to allow leading $ character as substitute for drive letter
Returns:
true if valid installdir string, false otherwise

Parameters:
p - an install path
Returns:

getPort

public static Port getPort(com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.Capability capability,
                           java.lang.String portName)
Returns the port capability of the specified name.

Parameters:
capability - a capability provided by a unit hosting a PortConfigUnit or the PortConfigUnit itself.
portName - the name to match against Port.getPortName() (null matches any name).
Returns:
the port number, or null if not found or undefined.

getPort

                           java.lang.String portName)
Returns the port capability of the specified name.

Parameters:
unit - a unit hosting a PortConfigUnit or the PortConfigUnit itself.
portName - the name to match against Port.getPortName() (null matches any name).
Returns:
the port number, or null if not found or undefined.
